numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The graph depicts every major league sport.
2. In every depicted major league sport, the proportion of players of color is higher than the proportion of head coaches of color.
3. In every depicted major league sport except baseball, players of color are the majority of all players.
4. In baseball, players of color are not the majority of all players.
5. In every depicted major league sport, head coaches of color are less than half of all head coaches.
6. I wonder why this pattern emerges.
7. People of color make up large proportions of major league sports teams.
8. People of color do not make up large proportions of coaching staff in major league sports.
9. I wonder if specific roadblocks exist.
10. If specific roadblocks exist, then these roadblocks prevent some people of color from assuming coaching positions in major league sports.
12. Racial biases may be ingrained in major league sports industries.
13. Some people of color live in my community.
14. Some people of color in my community aspire to become professional coaches.
15. If racial biases are ingrained in major league sports industries, then it may be difficult for these people of color to become professional coaches.
16. The graph shows a discrepancy between the proportion of players of color and the proportion of head coaches of color in major league sports.
17. The headline is: The end of the rainbow: Are people of color being prevented from becoming head coaches in major league sports?
